com.pump.swing

Class ShapeCreationPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • com.pump.swing.ShapeCreationPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class ShapeCreationPanel
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    A panel used to define a series of shapes.

    There are a few different ShapeCreationUIs to choose from. Once the appropriate UI is installed: just call shapePanel.setMode( MODE_CREATE ) to the user to be able to draw shapes in this panel.

    You may want to override the UI to paint additional components or to better control the stroke/paints used.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • MODE_DEFAULT

        public static final java.lang.String MODE_DEFAULT
        This is default mode for this panel. In this mode shapes can usually be selected, translated, and deleted: but not created.
        See Also:
        getMode(), Constant Field Values

      • MODE_CREATE

        public static final java.lang.String MODE_CREATE
        This is the mode used exclusively for creating shapes. In this mode when the user clicks in this panel: new shapes are added to the data model.
        See Also:
        getMode(), Constant Field Values
